text: Rocky Krsnich (born Rocco Peter Krznić; August 5, 1927 – February 14, 2019) was a Major League Baseball third baseman. == Biography == He was born in West Allis, Wisconsin. Krsnich originally signed as a free agent in 1945 with the Philadelphia Phillies. The following year, he joined the New York Yankees organization. In 1948, Krsnich was selected in the Minor League Draft by the Chicago White Sox. During his time with the White Sox, Krsnich played at the Major League level in 1949, as well as in 1952 and 1953. Later he was traded along with Saul Rogovin and Connie Ryan to the Cincinnati Reds for Willard Marshall. He is the brother of former MLB player Mike Krsnich. Krsnich died February 14, 2019. ==References== ==External links== Category:1927 births Category:2019 deaths Category:People from West Allis, Wisconsin Category:American people of Serbian descent Category:Baseball players from Wisconsin Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Major League Baseball third basemen Category:Sportspeople from the Milwaukee metropolitan area
title: Rocky Krsnich
